children.text: The brain can’t stay in flow all the time. In a creative, flow state, the mind works optimally for about 90 minutes to 2 hours. You can make the most of this time with techniques like the Pomodoro method. Focused periods alternated with brief periods of rest allow your brain to be it's most efficient and creative without triggering burnout.

content:
### Customizable Content Editor and a Feature Rich CLI
With [Sanity](https://www.sanity.io/), your content is treated as structured data and is made available through a simple and powerful API. You can edit it collaboratively and freely decide later how and where it will be distributed and used.
### Features
1. Sanity Studio. An open-source, customizable content editing environment built with React.js that includes advanced editing features such as Block content and Structure Builder
2. Content Lake. A fully managed cloud data store can be accessed either by using one of the client libraries or directly via HTTP.
3. Content modeling with schema types
4. A Query Language (GROQ) can be used to retrieve collections of schema-less JSON documents.
5. Your Frontends and tools can be notified whenever the content is changed using real-time listeners or via webhooks, where the changes are submitted as HTTP requests to a custom URL.
6. Assets management, image transformations, and an Asset pipeline.
7. A Command Line Interface makes it easy to create new projects and set up, import, and tear down datasets.
title: Sanity. The perfect headless CMS.

content:
1.  Create a GoatCounter account. Set up certain options (pretty straightforward). Remember your `[goatcounter-code]`
2.  [Download script](https://www.svirins.codes/scripts/goatcounter.js "Download script") and put in into `/public/scripts` (or you can consider loading script from GoatCounter CDN).
3.  Set CSP (Content Security Policy) in `next.config.js` to allow scripts from `*.goatcounter.com`:
```js:next.config.js
...
script-src 'self' 'unsafe-eval' 'unsafe-inline' *.goatcounter.com;
...

```
4.  Add custom `Script` component to `_document.tsx`
```ts:_document.tsx
import Document, { Head, Html, Main, NextScript } from 'next/document';
import Script from 'next/script';
...
 <NextScript />
 <Script
   src="/scripts/goatcounter.js"
   data-goatcounter="https://[goatcounter-code].goatcounter.com/count"
   data-goatcounter-settings='{"no_onload": true, "allow_local": false}'
   strategy="afterInteractive"
 />
...

```
5.  Make Typescript happy:
```ts:environment.d.ts
declare global {
  interface Window {
    goatcounter: any;
  }
...
}
```
6.  Voilà 🎉!
title: Adding GoatCounter analytics to a Next.js site

content:
Vercel has [released](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-12-2) version 12.2 of its Next.js React-based framework, with key features now stable and new experimental APIs.
### Middleware
The concept of middleware is all about providing features needed for enterprise application delivery, such as authorization and geographic localization.

The GA version of Middleware has breaking changes from the beta. Middleware functions can no longer be nested, but must now be in a single root Middleware, one code file written in either TypeScript or JavaScript. The docs say that this is both faster and cheaper. It remains possible to execute code based on request paths or other conditions.

Another change is that Middleware can no longer generate a response body, but instead must use rewrite or redirect to modify an incoming request. There are also changes to the cookie API.
### The Edge
Traditionally, the codebase is fully run on the origin servers. Depending on the location of the application servers (regional or multi-regional), user locations, and server configuration, the performance and latency can be an issue. With the lightweight Edge runtime, many components have been offloaded to the globally distributed Edge infrastructure, which drastically improves user experience. New in this version is Edge API routes, for building APIs using the same Next.js Edge Runtime used by Middleware. Edge API routes are in beta. Another new feature, designated as experimental, is an option to use Edge server rendering with the Edge Runtime instead of Node.js for server-side rendering of pages. The documentation states that the Edge Runtime has “lower latency as well as a better scalability.”
### On-Demand Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR).
Another feature now declared stable is on-demand incremental static regeneration, a feature added in beta in Next.js 12.1. Incremental means that static page regeneration can be done on a page-by-page basis, with no need to rebuild an entire site. On-demand means that a revalidation API can be called when content changes. This enables the faster delivery of pages with the most current information.
### `next/future/image` component
This is a preview of the upcoming next/image component, which is built to improve performance and solve several pain points of the current version (mainly due to the opinionated nature when the component was first released)
title: Next.js 12.2 Release

content:
Keep in mind: during calibration, your screen will _go blank_* for a few mins.

```shell
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:linrunner/tlp
sudo apt update
sudo apt install tlp tlp-rdw --no-install-recommends
sudo apt install acpi-call-dkms
sudo tlp-stat
sudo apt install powertop
sudo powertop -c

```
Tested on Pop! OS 22.04 and LDME 5.
description: Install tlp on Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Carbon gen 7
title: Calibrate your ThinkPad laptop battery on Linux

content:
1.  Import your Sanity config:
```ts:pages/[[...index]].tsx
import config from '../sanity.config'
import { StudioPageLayout } from ' @sanity/next-studio-layout'

export default function StudioPage() {
/*
 * Loads the Studio, with all the needed meta tags 
 * and global CSS reqiired for * it to render correctly
 */
return <StudioPageLayout config={config} />
}
```
2.  Set up SSR for styled-components, ensuring there's no missing CSS when deploying a Studio in Next.js into production:
```ts:_document.tsx
import { ServerStyleSheetDocument } from '@sanity/next-studio-layout'
...
export default class Document extends ServerStyleSheetDocument {}

```
description: The latest version of Sanity Studio allows you to embed a near-infinitely configurable content editing interface into any React application.
title: Sanity Studio emdedded into Next.js pages
